DataElement.preferredName: Recurrent Disease Assessment Molecular Analysis Recurrent Disease Or Progressive Disease Status Yes No Character Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the status via molecular analysis was considered a disease relapse or progression.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Recurrent Disease Assessment Molecular Analysis Recurrent Disease Or Progressive Disease Status
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission._The act of judging the value, significance, or extent of something._Techniques for studying or analyzing the genetic composition and mechanisms of living organisms at the molecular level. May refer to the understanding and manipulation of genes (DNA)._The return of a disease after a period of remission._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.:Techniques for studying or analyzing the genetic composition and mechanisms of living organisms at the molecular level. May refer to the understanding and manipulation of genes (DNA).

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
A laboratory procedure that involves the study of tissues, cells, and fluids using DNA/RNA analysis techniques for the identification of characteristics and abnormalities at the molecular level.

Property.preferredDefinition: the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.:Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
A condition or state at a particular time.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)
